scenario:
NVIDIA announced generative AI models and blueprints that expand NVIDIA Omniverse integration into physical AI applications such as robotics, autonomous vehicles, and vision AI. Global leaders in software development and professional services are using Omniverse to develop new products and services that will accelerate the next era of industrial AI. 

Accenture, Altair, Ansys, Cadence, Foretellix, Microsoft, and Neural Concept are among the first to integrate Omniverse into their next-generation software products and professional services. Siemens announced the availability of Teamcenter Digital Reality Viewer, the first Siemens Xcelerator application powered by NVIDIA Omniverse libraries.

NVIDIA offers generative AI models that accelerate world building for physical AI simulation, including USD Code and USD Search NVIDIA NIM microservices, and a new NVIDIA Edify SimReady generative AI model that can automatically label existing 3D assets with attributes like physics or materials. 

NVIDIA Omniverse, paired with new NVIDIA Cosmos world foundation models, creates a synthetic data multiplication engine, letting developers easily generate massive amounts of controllable, photoreal synthetic data. 

Four new blueprints were announced to make it easier for developers to build Universal Scene Description (OpenUSD)-based Omniverse digital twins for physical AI, including Mega, Autonomous Vehicle (AV) Simulation, Omniverse Spatial Streaming to Apple Vision Pro, and Real-Time Digital Twins for Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE).

Market leaders are using Omniverse to develop new products and services that are poised to accelerate the next era of industrial AI, including Cadence, Altair, Ansys, and Neural Concept. 

NVIDIA's products and technologies, including NVIDIA Omniverse, NVIDIA NIM microservices, NVIDIA Edify SimReady generative AI model, NVIDIA Cosmos world foundation models, and NVIDIA Blueprints, are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause results to be materially different than expectations. 

NVIDIA is the world leader in accelerated computing, and its products and technologies are subject to change and remain at the sole discretion of NVIDIA.
